# Rules of Engagement
These regulations define the authorized use of force. These rules may be modified by the Acting Commander, provided any changes remain compliant with SOP and the UCMJ.
## Protection of Non-Combatants - Civilians and other non-combatants must not be intentionally harmed. - Protected persons (including civilians, medical personnel and surrendering or incapacitated enemy combatants) must not be unlawfully targeted or have equipment seized from them. - Enemy personnel who surrender or are otherwise unable to fight must not be harmed and must receive medical treatment equal to that available to friendly forces within the AO.
## Requisition - Personnel may requisition useful equipment found within the AO, including weapons, ammunition, tools, and supplies.
## Use of Force - Force may only be used when necessary and must be proportionate to the threat. - Non-lethal means should be used when feasible. - Hostile personnel presenting an immediate threat to friendly forces or civilians may be engaged with lethal force.
## Structures and Demolitions - Buildings, fortifications and obstacles within the AO may be constructed, modified, or deconstructed for strategic purposes. - Care must be taken to minimize damage to protected property (Hospitals, Churches, etc)
## Neutral or Non-Hostile Armed Forces - Military or paramilitary forces encountered in the AO who are not conducting hostile actions may be allowed to continue their operations. - Such forces may only be engaged if they interfere with mission objectives or present a credible threat to personnel.
